result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:47 PM Defendant ERIK M ADLER in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court for ERIK M ADLER.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Johnson states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint with copy to Atty Johnson. Attorney Johnson acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Johnson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 2:50 PM
Return date scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:05 PM Defendant ERIK M ADLER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests it's reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
